{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3496686,"name":"Jacob","username":"_Jacob","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/_jacob/{size}/211203_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T15:21:10.885Z","cooked":"

Hello,
My team is setting up the new VH-109 radios and I am having some trouble connecting wirelessly to the access point. We have two radios, one on the robot and one for the driver station/access point. If I plug my computer in via ethernet to the access point, everything works perfect. The issue is that there is no wireless network, and we have multiple computers that need to connect (one of them doesn’t have an ethernet port). Is there anything that I need to do in order to get the wireless network up?

I have followed all these steps and the articles in each step, but the network is still not appearing. Maybe I did something wrong?

frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net

Quick Start Guide | FIRST FRC Radio

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T15:21:10.885Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":147,"reads":173,"readers_count":172,"score":769.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484291,"topic_slug":"wirelessly-connecting-to-new-vh-109-radio","display_username":"Jacob","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/quick-start-guide","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Quick Start Guide | FIRST FRC Radio","clicks":14}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63329,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/wirelessly-connecting-to-new-vh-109-radio/484291/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3496703,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T15:37:36.098Z","cooked":"

By using 1 robot radio and 1 robot radio as an access point, when you configure each of those to the same SSID (team number), and password - they will automatically link to eachother.

Your driverstation should then be typically hard wired to the radio configured as an access point to communicate with the robot. You wont need to use windows to wirelessly connect in this configuration.

For your laptop that dosent have an ethernet jack you can purchase an adapter (either USB-A or USB-C).

Alternatively you reportedly can connect your driverstation laptop to the wireless access point WIRELESSLY but only if you have a driverstation laptop with WIFI 6E - which will typically be machines that are BRAND NEW or only a year or so old. Any machines from 4+yrs ago will not be able to do this without upgrading the wireless card internal to the laptop or purchasing an external WIFI6E dongle. I believe documentation on this is lighter than other connection methods as its been more recently discovered/thought of.

Refer to this page for different network infrastructures.

Do you know if it’s possible to use an ethernet switch on the access point so that I can have multiple laptops plugged into the DS port? We have a programming laptop and a driver laptop, so ideally both would be connected at the same time.

@Jwal Have you’ll had any issue gettin the DS to see the robot? We have the pair of radios configured (one on AP, one on Client) and while the robot seems to link (no broadcast 6E network), it won’t show up for the DS computer.
